snippet: Israel on Friday said it was prepared to pause its assault during a visit by Egypt’s prime minister, a day after Palestinian militants fired hundreds of rockets and Israeli tanks rumbled toward the Gaza border.
abstract: Israel and Hamas brush aside international calls for restraint and escalate their lethal conflict over Gaza, where Palestinian militants fire hundreds of rockets into Israeli territory and Israeli tanks rumble toward Gaza border; at least 19 people in Gaza and 3 Israelis are killed over two days of nearly nonstop aerial attacks.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Kiryat Malachi, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Fares Akram from Gaza, Rina Castelnuovo from Kiryat Malachi, Mayy El Sheikh and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo, Gabby Sobelman from Jerusalem, Alan Cowell from Paris and Elisabeth Bumiller from Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: Israel on Friday said it was prepared to pause its assault during a visit by Egypt’s prime minister, a day after Palestinian militants fired hundreds of rockets and Israeli tanks rumbled toward the Gaza border.

headline.seo: Israel and Hamas Step Up Air Attacks in Gaza Clash
headline.main: Israel and Hamas Step Up Air Attacks in Gaza Clash
headline.print_headline: Israel and Hamas Step Up Air Attacks in Gaza Clash
